subject: Medicine
title: Sleep and Memory
description: A short lesson to help you apply Sleep and Memory.

hook.text: Students who sleep after studying score 20â€“30% higher than those who stay up cramming all night.

buildup.text: During sleep, the brain replays the day's experiences, strengthening important connections and pruning weak ones.

discovery.text: Different sleep stages handle different memory types: REM for emotional memories, deep sleep for facts.

twist.text: Even a 20-minute nap can significantly boost learning and problem-solving ability.

climax.text: Sleep deprivation doesn't just make you tiredâ€”it physically blocks the brain from forming new memories.

punchline.text: Sleep is when your brain does its homework.

quiz.question: What happens to memory formation during sleep deprivation?
options: The brain is physically blocked from forming new memories
Memories form normally but are harder to recall
